column1: In the BoxBrazil e-commerce project we suffered a brute force attack coming from inside the AWS network that the firewall couldn't filter.
I implemented a strict password policy via system-level enforcement in most of all my web services. so guaranteed no access to our database and information without strong authentication
column2: strong password requirements and one direction encryption.

column1: And those resources that are public and not sensible information
column2: I block the offending IP request returning a bad request 400 code

column1: So this platform worked properly during the attack and until AWS support resolved the attack.
